title: Looking for a script face similar to "Peterbilt" logo
content:
I'm guessing this is a custom face, but anyone know of a typeface close to this one? ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080401010300im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47890.gif)

 [‹ (x) InSpec Intl. - Poppl Laudatio {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080401010300/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6445 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Fremont Presbyterian Church - Schneidler Initials, Erazure {Marc O, Mike Y} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080401010300/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6444 "Go to next forum topic")
author: anonymous

comments.content: Do you also have an annoying tune. I once suggested that the Mister Softee tune be used by the CIA to break terrorists. Just put them in a room and play that tune over and over

See [Part 7 of the Script Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20080401010300/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script07Pg1.html) for other casual flowing script designs, and you can choose what you think looks close. Then use the Script Font Reference List links on each page to find out where to get them.   
   
This is a do-it-yourself style answer, because I am too busy right now.
